I had some trouble getting this to work. Here's what I did: 

Install Daemon Tools. (http://www.daemon-tools.cc/dtcc/portal/download.php) Restart your computer, and a little icon will show up in your system tray. 

Now, go to the Rome: Total War Reloaded download folder, and go into each of the CDX folders and un-RAR the files. (You'll only be able to un-RAR one of the three .RAR files in each CDX folder...it's more or less guess-and-check, as far as I know). Make sure you do this in both CD1, CD2 and CD3. 

Now, right click on the Daemon Tools, go to "Virtual CD/DVD-ROM," "Device 0," and then "Mount Image." Browse the Rome: Total War directory again and go to CD1 and select the .cue file. (This will only be there if you un-RARed earlier!) 

Next, go to "My Computer," and click the "Rome_TW_CD1" icon. Select "setup." Now run as you would normally install a program. During installation, you'll get an error, saying that it can't find a certain file. Minimize the installation (CTR + ESC). Again, go to "Virtual CD/DVD-Rom," "Device 0: RTWA.cue," then "Mouth Image." Browse to your Rome: Total War directory, and this time select the .cue inside "CD2." Return to set-up, and continue. Eventually, it will say it can't find a file. Once again, re-mount a file over the old one. This time, select the .cue out of CD3. 

After installation completes, go to the first CD (re-mount it), and copy the EXE out of the crack folder. Replace this with the EXE in your main Rome: Total War directory that you installed in.

Hope this helps!

"I had some trouble getting this to work. Here's what I did: 


Install Daemon Tools. (http://www.daemon-tools.cc/dtcc/portal/download.php) Restart your computer, and a little icon will show up in your system tray. 


Now, go to the Rome: Total War Reloaded download folder, and go into each of the CDX folders and un-RAR the files. (You'll only be able to un-RAR one of the three .RAR files in each CDX folder...it's more or less guess-and-check, as far as I know). Make sure you do this in both CD1, CD2 and CD3. 


Now, right click on the Daemon Tools, go to "Virtual CD/DVD-ROM," "Device 0," and then "Mount Image." Browse the Rome: Total War directory again and go to CD1 and select the .cue file. (This will only be there if you un-RARed earlier!) 


Next, go to "My Computer," and click the "Rome_TW_CD1" icon. Select "setup." Now run as you would normally install a program. During installation, you'll get an error, saying that it can't find a certain file. Minimize the installation (CTR + ESC). Again, go to "Virtual CD/DVD-Rom," "Device 0: RTWA.cue," then "Mouth Image." Browse to your Rome: Total War directory, and this time select the .cue inside "CD2." Return to set-up, and continue. Eventually, it will say it can't find a file. Once again, re-mount a file over the old one. This time, select the .cue out of CD3. 


After installation completes, go to the first CD (re-mount it), and copy the EXE out of the crack folder. Replace this with the EXE in your main Rome: Total War directory that you installed in. 


Hope this helps!
"
